text: Richard Louis Trumka (July 24, 1949 – August 5, 2021)Who's Who in America. 62nd ed. New Providence, N.J.: Marquis Who's Who, 2007. was an American lawyer and organized labor leader. He was President of the AFL–CIO from 2009 until his death. He was the secretary-treasurer of the AFL-CIO from 1995 to 2009. He was president of the United Mine Workers from 1982 to 1995. He was born in Nemacolin, Pennsylvania. Trumka died on August 5, 2021 from a heart attack in Washington, D.C., aged 72. ==References== Category:1949 births Category:2021 deaths Category:Lawyers from Pittsburgh Category:Lawyers from Washington, D.C. Category:American political activists Category:Businesspeople from Pittsburgh Category:Businesspeople from Washington, D.C. Category:Deaths from myocardial infarction
title: Richard Trumka
